name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Valentine’s Day is tomorrow. For those who haven’t stopped at CVS to buy a gift on the way home from work yet, quick reminder, no grown woman wants a stuffed animal.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I have a theory. Valentine’s Day was made up by the greeting card companies to trick you into telling your wife you love her.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The worst part of Valentine’s Day is when you call to order flowers and you order the flowers and the guy on the other end of the phone says, “What would you like your card to say?” You should say something romantic or poetic but in order to do that you have to dictate it to a stranger.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Which is not comfortable. I mean, “Dear Kathy, I love you. You mean the world to me. Happy Valentine’s Day. Love, Snookie Bear.” It’s a violation is what it is! See, these are the jobs we need robots to take from us.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The White House is releasing their own line of cards this year. Have you heard about this? That’s because we made it up. Funny, we’re at the point where anything is believable.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Here are some of the cards they’re offering. It’s best-seller comes from President Trump. It says, “I flip for you.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Donald Trump Jr.: “I’ll be thinking of you from prison” or “I love you like daddy loves Jared.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Jared has a card that says, “You make my cold dead stare come alive.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Melania has a good card: “Whatever Michelle Obama said last Valentine’s Day.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Mitch McConnell: “I’m gonna move on you like a Mitch.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: And finally, Trump’s Valentine, good old Vladimir Putin: “I can inject you into my Olympic team because you are dope!”
